Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.soen6441.risk_game_u14.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
This is a model class for the game players
Author:
Devansh, Aditya, Karandeep

    boolean
    isD_SaveGame()
     
    void
    issueOrder()
    The issue order method evaluates the order given by the player, which falls into one of five types: Deploy Order: Deploys the specified number of armies to the designated country. Advance Order: Initiates an attack on the target country with a specified number of armies from the source country. Bomb Order: Launches a bombing operation on a specified country. Blockade Order: Transforms the player's own country into a neutral territory by tripling its current armies. AirLift Order: Moves armies from the source country to a target country, even if they are not neighbors. Negotiate Order: Establishes a diplomatic agreement between the issuing player and another player, preventing attacks on each other's countries.

    • setPlayerContinent

      public void setPlayerContinent()
      This method checks that the player has captured the whole continent and if yes, adds the continent value (reward) to the reinforcement armies

    • clearPlayerContinent

      public void clearPlayerContinent()
      Clears the list of continents owned by the player. The player's owned continents list is reset to an empty state.

      Returns:

    • findPlayerByName

      public Player findPlayerByName(String p_name)
      Searches for a player by their name within the game.
      Parameters:
      p_name - The name of the player being searched for.
      Returns:
      The Player object if a player with the specified name is found within the game; otherwise, returns null.

    • issueOrder

      public void issueOrder()
      The issue order method evaluates the order given by the player, which falls into one of five types:
      • Deploy Order: Deploys the specified number of armies to the designated country.
      • Advance Order: Initiates an attack on the target country with a specified number of armies from the source country.
      • Bomb Order: Launches a bombing operation on a specified country.
      • Blockade Order: Transforms the player's own country into a neutral territory by tripling its current armies.
      • AirLift Order: Moves armies from the source country to a target country, even if they are not neighbors.
      • Negotiate Order: Establishes a diplomatic agreement between the issuing player and another player, preventing attacks on each other's countries.

    • nextOrder

      public Order nextOrder()
      This method pops an order to the player's order
      Returns:
      it returns the order
